attributes.action: Force the Premier League to reduce the cost of attending football.
attributes.additional_details:
Football in England is being priced out of reach of the common football fan.  What used to be a family tradition has turned into a over priced event that only the 'well off' can seriously afford.  At some clubs a family of four can end up paying anything between £200 and £300 to attend one game including tickets, food and travel.  This is ridiculous.

I am asking for the Department for Culture, Media and Sport to force the Premier League to ask it's members to reduce the cost of ticketing to enable the true fans to return to the game.  We should be looking to use the same system as the Bundesliga in Germany.

rejection.details: The pricing of football matches in England is a matter for the governing bodies - the FA, the Premier League and the Football League.
